message:
I'm sorry, Sam, but there are no basic steps.  

I recommend reading my TCP/IP blog posts, and then reading the items listed in the Resources blog post: [http://nitoprograms.blogspot.com/2009/05/tcpip-resources.html](http://nitoprograms.blogspot.com/2009/05/tcpip-resources.html)  

Then you'll have enough information to design a custom TCP/IP protocol.  

If you want a simpler solution, you could use Web API, WCF, or .NET remoting.
